title: Ushering Green & Digital Hospitals: Enabling Energy Saving through ICT
author: SECTIONS Ushering Green; Digital Hospitals Enabling Energy Saving through ICT ET Spotlight
description: Hitachi has enhanced the Social, Environmental and Economic values and significantly contributed to realizing the Government of India's policies on Green Hospital, Digital India and e-Healthcare to power good a Sustainable Society.
cleaned_text: other energy-saving measures Ushering social innovation in the healthcare sector, Hitachi's Infrastructure Systems Division leveraged its OT X IT expertise to implement ICT and other energy-saving measures that could optimize up to 30% reduction in energy consumption. The team modernized AIIMS' power infrastructure to make the hospital both environment-friendly and patient-friendly at the same time. - Installed a new rooftop Solar Power system of 693 kilowatts peak (KWp) to bring clean solar energy to AIIMS. - Installed a new Hybrid Power Factor Correction (HPFC) system to ensure less harmonics and balanced load in the electrical system, thereby drastically improving the availability and reliability of medical equipment like MRI and X-Ray machines. - Upgraded the Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) system at the hospital with state-of-the-art, energy-efficient equipment. - Replaced 33,000 conventional lights with LED lights for better lux level and savings in energy. - Deployed an ICT-enabled Energy Management System (EMS) to integrate different systems and enable real-time energy optimization.
